title: Prime Minister of Australia
summary: The prime minister of Australia is the head of government and chief minister of the crown of Australia. The prime minister is the leader of the executive branch of the federal government of Australia and is also accountable to federal parliament under the principles of responsible government. The post is usually held by the leader of the majority party in the national parliament. The incumbent prime minister is Scott Morrison, who took office in August 2018 as leader of the Liberal Party.
